div.l: But for the loue of god thei hym be souȝt
Of herber and of eese as for hyr peny
The myller seid ageyn yf ther be any
Suche as hit is ȝet shall ȝe haue ȝour part
My hous is streit but ȝe haue lerned art
Ȝe can be argument maken a place
A myle brood of twenty foote of space
Late se now yf that this place mow suffice
Or make hit rowmer with spech as is ȝoure gyse
Now symond seid this Iohn by seint Cuthberd
Ay is thow mery and that is fair answerd
I haue herd sey men̄ shall take of twa thinges
Swilke as he fyndes or swylk as he brynges
But specialy I pray the ooste dere
Gete vs som mete and drynk and make vs chere
And we will pay trewly at the full
With empty handes men may noon haukes tulle
Loo here oure syluer redy for to spende
This meller to the towne his doughter ysende
For ale ⁊and breed and rosted hem a goos
And bonde hir hors he shuld no more go loose
And in his owne chambre he made a bedde
With shetis ⁊and with chalons fair yspredde
Noȝt from his owne bedde ten fote or twefe
His doghter had a bed by hir selfe
Ryght in the same chambre by ⁊and by
Hit myght be not bette and caus why
Ther was no rowmer herbery in the place
Thei sopen and thei speken hom to solace
And drynken̄ euer strong ale at the best
Aboute mydnyght went thei to rest
Wele hath this myller vernysshed his heede
Full pale he was for dronken ⁊and noȝt reede
